subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|又|t1=hand|肉|alt2=⺼|t2=meat|ls=ic|ls2=psc|c1=p|c2=s}} – a hand holding meat, hence “in possession of”. The hand shape has been significantly abstracted; compare {{och-l|右}}.

Alternatively, the graph was perhaps originally intended for the word {{och-l|醢|minced pickled meat}}, which also has the {{och-l|又}} element as phonetic.

''{{w|Shuowen Jiezi}}'' and other ancient sources have erroneously analyzed the character as a {{Han compound|又|c1=p|月|c2=s|t2=moon|ls=psc|nocap=1}}. ''Shuowen Jiezi'' defines {{lang|zh|有}} as "{{lang|zh|不宜有也}}" ("[to have something that] not should be had"), citing the ''{{w|Spring and Autumn Annals}}'' ({{lang|zh|春秋傳}}): "{{lang|zh|日月有食之}}" ("There are solar and lunar eclipses"). As eclipses were not auspicious to the Chinese, they were "something that should not be happening". The {{lang|zh|月}} component alludes to the inauspicious lunar eclipse.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Possibly Sino-Tibetan. Compare {{cog|bo|ཡོད||to be; to have}}. Related to:

* {{och-l|侑|to offer, to sacrifice}} [causative, i.e. “to cause to have”]
* {{och-l|又|again}} [adverbial]
* {{och-l|或|some; or}} [indefinite]

subSections.title: Definitions
Usage notes
subSections.text:
* In Mandarin, {{lang|zh|有}} is the only verb not negated with {{zh-l|不}}. It is negated with {{zh-l|沒}}.
:: {{zh-x|我 沒有 錢|I don't have any money}}
